text.name: sys_description
text.text: Released in 2001, the GC did not meet the success of its elders, facing the PS2, XBox and Dreamcast. A cable however made it possible to use GBA as a controller with a remote screen for Zelda Four Swords Adv. and in 2002 released the Wavebird, the first wireless controller by radio wave. Equipped with a processor at 486 Mhz, an ATI graphics chip at 162 Mhz and 40 MB of RAM it can calculate 15 million polygons. It displays 640Ã—480 60 Hz or 768x576 50 Hz and offers sound in Dolby Pro Logic 2. It presents a catalog of 644 games including games like Resident Evil 4 and Viewtiful Joe.
